website_summaries.verdict: Move over, BB-8: The Air Hogs Ultimate Millennium Falcon is a good fit for anyone -- young or old -- who just wants a cool little quad to fly around the house.
pros: The Air Hogs Ultimate Millennium Falcon is a ready-to-fly toy quadcopter that's very easy to get the hang of and soft enough to not do any damage to furniture and walls while you're learning
It can be charged off the controller's batteries or via USB to a computer or wall adapter
cons: Battery life is between 5 to 8 minutes
Nonremovable battery takes about an hour to recharge
High-pitched whine from its motors can get irritating

customer_reviews.title: Flying time becomes less after a month of charging
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old 2 times. And both times the same issues with charging and battery life happened. This is a great toy and very easy to fly and i do not mind that out of the box it only lasted no more then 10 minutes for every charge but with in a month of use the charging became an issue where it would not fully charge and would only last a few minutes after each charge. Ive even replaced batteries in the remote several time and still only charged up to fly a couple of minutes. So now after a couple month both are useless.
customer_reviews.author: John D Strauss

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it and it breaks no one will help or replace it.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother, my son was beyond excited for this and only worked for maybe 2 months, would only fly super low and flip, nothings broken or stuck I’ve carefully even opened to see the spinners and had purchased the Asurion insurance, Airhogs no longer makes them so they can’t replace it within the guarantee time frame and will try to give you a cheap 20-30 dollar toy that has nothing to do with Star Wars or the Falcon. Asurion claims it’s their job to replace it, run around. If you purchase it just know even with insurance it won’t be replaced. Biggest disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: flor

customer_reviews.title: Charging connection broke after 5 charges
customer_reviews.text: This was my son's favorite birthday present. After using and charging it maybe five times, the delicate charging thing on the millennium falcon broke and now it won't charge. Is there anything Air Hogs/the seller can do for this? Please let me know. It would have 5 stars otherwise. He is crushed and wants another one from Santa and I don't think I can bring myself to buy it again knowing it will likely break by December 30th. If I had bought it at a regular store, I would be taking it back.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: I've got a bad feeling about this
customer_reviews.text: Fun little toy. Sturdy and stands up to lots of crashing, which is good because it can be tough to fly (which I suppose the real one is too, at least according to Han). Can't beat it for the price, fun factor, and novelty (hey.. it's star wars), just don't expect it to fly as good as your traditional quad copter/drone. Flies ok outside but is very light. If there is any wind, it becomes more of a kite than a quad copter. Feels delicate, but handles the abuse. Flight time is reasonable at ~ 8-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a blast to fly around. It isn't anywhere near as loud as I thought it would be, and it's pretty fast. Given how lightweight it is, you definitely don't want to fly this outside. One gust of wind will snatch this Falcon away from you, and carry it off to who-knows-where. My 6 year loves this thing. I've seen mentions of people upgrading the battery in this, but honestly, the flight-time out of the box is just fine. You get about 10 or 15 minutes, I think (though I haven't time it).
customer_reviews.author: K. ReynoldsTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Cool star wars drone, but takes a lot of batteries
customer_reviews.text: Wow is the word here. Our family has gone through a number of different drones with my nearly-11-year-old son. Previously, they have all had open blades, and they last about 30 min. This Air Hog Millenium Falcon has lasted us for over a week now, with no sign of stopping. It works great indoors, though I have my concerns about when it warms up and they take it outside. It is STAR WARS, so of course that is a cool factor. The material is just painted styrofoam, and the thing eats batteries like crazy. It also takes 6 AA batteries, which is going to run you up a nice bill.
customer_reviews.author: Brennon Adams

customer_reviews.title: Falcon doesn't charge - customer support disconnects without answering after 16 minutes on hold
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas, and was so excited that I had finally gotten him something he would be enthusiastic about. It worked for about 3 minutes then seemed to lose it's charge. Tried to charge it and charge indicator light on the remote would never come on (Falcon will not charge). Tried unplugging everything and trying it all again - even put in new AA batteries,for electronics to no avail. Tried calling customer service and after waiting on hold for a little over 16 minutes, they hung up, (automatically I think). My husband is disappointed and I am returning this. So Frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift. Durable, easy to use, and way too much fun.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. I saw some saying it's foam and flimsy but I do not agree. This thing can take a fall better then most drones. I think it's cause it's so light and the foam kinda protects the blades. it came two days earlier then what was expected. When I saw that there weren't any (trim) adjustment buttons I was worried. But this is very good at keep level and not crashing during maneuvers. I've spent more money on brookstone garbage that wasn't half as fun or easy to fly. Only reason I'm not giving this thing five stars is because the battery life could have been better. But besides that this is a perfect purchase.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for husband for his birthday a year ago and he loves it. My 2 year old son asks for him to fly it just about every day. To be honest it doesn’t hold a long charge - maybe 5 minutes or a little more. Then my husband recharges it and they play again. It isn’t a big deal but might be for some. We have really enjoyed this
customer_reviews.author: Val P

customer_reviews.title: Really cool toy!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got three little brothers and they thought this was the coolest gift they got this past Christmas! It seemed to charge fine that day but I haven’t seen if fly yet, but I assume it’s been fine. Hopefully they don’t destroy it as fast as their other toys!
customer_reviews.author: Guinness Cosplay

customer_reviews.title: Peter Pan can’t even get this thing to fly
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t surprised by the price for a Disney brand drone. What did surprise me was the price for a Disney Brand drone with worse flying capabilities than a pull string helicopter. Giving it 2 stars because its a Millenium Falconz
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Nothwang

customer_reviews.title: Really fun to play with - will definitely be appreciated by Star Wars fanatics.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the smaller version from Target but ended up taking it back because I found this one and that was a great decision. I had a very hard time learning to control it but my boyfriend who plays video games pretty avidly was able to fly/control it immediately. It's really fun to play with and the lights and sounds are responsive to certain movements which is extra cool. However, the fly time is super short and the batteries wear out really quickly in the remote. (The charging system is weird too.) but I'd say it's definitely worth it if you're a fan of Star Wars!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: We just love this product!! My 9 yr old son and I have flown this RC Millennium Falcon for countless hours around the interior of the house. It charges up fast and you get 6-8 minutes of flight time. It is also able to take a beating and has withstood bouncing off walls, dog attacks, and freefalling to the ground once out of juice without incident. Just wish it lasted longer on a single charge.....
customer_reviews.author: Bugman24

customer_reviews.title: About what was expected.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as xmas gift for son. It is fun to play around with but hard to control. Indoors it is hard to keep altitude steady (either sinks to floor or hits ceiling) and tends to drift a bit. Outdoors the poor thing gets blown around in anything more than a very light breeze and the rotors are too small/not enough power to compensate. Battery on vehicle drains after about 10-15 min continuous use, which is about expected but it does put a damper on things if you are out and about
customer_reviews.author: cjoslyn

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: After having a helicopter that seemed very hard to control, I do feel like this is a little better. It still requires some work, but it can be controlled for some good flights. It's also very light (feels kind of like styrofoam), so you don't have to worry about it breaking - or breaking anything else - if it comes crashing down.
customer_reviews.author: JJinNY

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to fly (for adults or kids)
customer_reviews.text: Air Hogs Millennium Falcon Fun, cool toy but it is hard to fly. It takes a very steady hand, at best, and plenty of practice to control. Not easy for adults, let alone kids. Having only had it a few days, I don't know how long it takes to get good at flying it, or if it is just quirky and a bit uncontrollable. So, at this price, I'm not sure if it is a great kid's toy. The good news is it takes some abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: My son and I have had a ton of fun with this
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have had a ton of fun with this. A house or apartment with vaulted ceilings (and no running ceiling fans) is the perfect environment for playing with it. I wouldn't recommend taking it outside though. It's been surprisingly durable having survived some pretty horrific crashes at the hands of my 6 year old. The battery life could be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fun indoor Star Wars drone
customer_reviews.text: Fun indoor Star Wars drone. Have a lot of fun with it. It is light and made of a Styrofoam type material so generally safe indoors, However, because it is so light it does not work well outdoors. Controls are easy to use, and there is sound effects out of the controller that can be turned off. Product is nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Canes Fan

customer_reviews.title: THE millennium falcon
customer_reviews.text: To be a kid again!!! This is by far the best star wars drone out there and although the battery life if the drone is not that long ,8-10 minutes of continuous flying, the details and the over all look of the drone is great. I have been using it indoors and it's the coolest thing to see it fly around in your house :-). Kid friendly too! Don't miss it. I also have the X wing drone but that one is better for outdoor use and not as dele able as this drone.
customer_reviews.author: NFP

customer_reviews.title: Short and sweet -way too hard for a child to fly
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet -way too hard for a child to fly ...outside in a slight breeze totally forget it - it will wobble out of control and drop like a stone pancake ...indoor flying is best bet - but who has that kind of room ....I think you are better off buying a more stable traditional x shaped drone for a child and outside flying. FWIW .
customer_reviews.author: JOHN F

customer_reviews.title: It came DOA but I got refund...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it for a friend and he was able to fix it so its working great now....
customer_reviews.author: TechTip

customer_reviews.title: Great and durable for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my brother for Christmas and he LOVES it. The drone is a foam so it makes it a little bit more durable for a crash which I love. Wish the battery life lasted longer. I think we got maybe a good 30 minutes before the falcon would quit working and go dead. Other than that I do love this toy and its perfect for 10 year olds that want a drone but need to practice flying first.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: One of the best drones!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best drones!! The ship itself is made up of a high quality spongy foam and the spinner blades sit inside a circle cutout which prevents them from hitting a surface and breaking. Very easy for first time fliers, has the cool blue light on the back of the ship and additional lighting in the front. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: So Fun
customer_reviews.text: You cant really fly this thing outside when theres wind but I usually fly this indoors in my buddys house and its so fun. You can do really cool maneuvers when you get good with it. This thing is a blast
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Never worked for long
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has been disappointed with this gift. The charge only lasts a short time and the device stopped working completely after 5 weeks, just past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Kim K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: When reading reviews from people that say "This was defective right out of the box" it's tempting to think "Ah, but what are the odds that I'll get a defective one?". Well, I got one. The reviews are absolutely correct - the controller does not hold a charge and it does not sync with the drone. And to think this was a Christmas present... I wish I could return this item at warp speed, but I'll have to settle for UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: this thing is way cool just gave it to my son tonight at his ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing is way cool just gave it to my son tonight at his 7y birthday after al l the other kids leave it was cool when we got it going. It is made of molded stylophone so if you step on it its all over literally it will be all over. In peaces . It moves forwards an back side to side i'm going to buy a 2nd 1 for me hehehehe.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Super hard to control
customer_reviews.text: Super hard to control... Since it doesn't have any internal processor or gyroscope to maintain altitude or balance rotors' speed, you'd always need to play with the sticks to keep it in-place...
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toy.
customer_reviews.text: My son saved up for this toy for a few months. I was worried that it would break easily or be too difficult for him to fly (he is 7), but neither one of those things are an issue. It is very lightweight, but he's crashed it numerous times and you could never even tell. He is still learning it, but he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: StephTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever for Star Wars fan of any age.  Only lasts a few days...
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough review to write, as my son was over the moon about this gift. The first one lasted a few days, and then there was a problem with one of the fans. Amazon customer service was excellent, and replaced the item even though it was only available at a higher price. Only problem is the replacement suffers the same issue as the first, after about two days of use. Why create such an amazing toy that breaks so easily??? Air Hogs need to step up their game here.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary A Layne

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Bounced it around the apt and even off the ceiling fan and it still worked. Until one of the motors was bumped with a finger trying to catch it. The motor doesn't work so the drone can't hover any more. I got the service plan but I got to wait 30 days to go through Amazon. Got to deal with the manufacture, let's see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: H. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun for this tiny falcon!
customer_reviews.text: This little falcon is lots of fun, definitely worth getting for the look of frustration on my wife's face. She had a bit of a time, as I did, learning to fly it proficiently, but it is loads of fun!
customer_reviews.author: survivaljunky89

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic toy. Bought it for an adult star wars fan, and it's easy enough to use that the non-video gaming adults can use it too. For me, it was too pricey a gift for a child, but completely worth it for an adult. It got lots of play time over the holiday. Keep any dogs away though - the foam body could be easy and quickly ravaged.
customer_reviews.author: Abell Link

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, but you are paying extra for the Star Wars name
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy, easy to fly around the house. The foam body is resilient and won't damage the house (barring knocking something over). There are plenty of good drones cheaper, but if your a Star Wars fan this is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Great...with one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great product, first and foremost. Especially for indoor play. Very easy to control, once you're used to the controls, and the padding really helps to protect it from ramming in to things. However, the only bad thing is, no matter whether you charge it through the provided USB cord or through the controller, every 4-5 times be prepared to have buy 6 new AA batteries for the controller because they wear out very quickly. I've had this product a little over a month and have had the change all 6 AA Duracell batteries twice. Your options are: buy new batteries every few times, for spend another $25+ for a recharable battery set.
customer_reviews.author: Prstn_porter

customer_reviews.title: The charge time and energy consumption is average or better. It's closer in control to a cheaper helicopter ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the charging style with the controller, but I could have figured that out with a little more reading up on the product. The charge time and energy consumption is average or better. It's closer in control to a cheaper helicopter than a decent quad-copter, slightly easier to control. I'd by it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great Birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a great Birthday gift for my 8 year old. He loves start wars and he had before some experience with remote control helicopter and cars and was able within the first 2 days 5 (flights) to fly the Millenium Falcon controlled throughout the house. It is pretty rugged and the blades are pretty well hidden so when it hits an obstacle it just bounces of it. The controls are standard like for a drone or a remote control helicopter.
customer_reviews.author: FMK

customer_reviews.title: Fun to fly for a true Star Wars fan
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my husband. He loves it! Does take some time to charge but still enjoys it. Controls were easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with and way better than the x-wing.
customer_reviews.text: Flys super well. The battery seems to die rather quickly but could be worse. compared to the AIR HOGS x-wing this is a million times better. it can hover, and go pretty much any direction. has lights that match the Millennium Falcon in the movies. (Blue on the back and white on the front)
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first quadcopter and it's really easy to fly. It's amazingly durable! I've crashed it many times at the start and while some of the paint has chipped off the overall foam structure looks pretty much undamaged. The LED lights looks fantastic and hey, it's the Millenium Falcon! It's a lot of fun to fly!
customer_reviews.author: Carlo San Juan

customer_reviews.title: Good Indoor Quad...
customer_reviews.text: Good quad for flying indoors. Its yaw and position are highly susceptible to ANY breeze, no matter how slight. It's good for kids or adult beginners because it can take a lickin' and keep on tickin'...as they say. Remember to turn off the ceiling fans for best control.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J...

customer_reviews.title: This is the best flying device we have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the best flying device we have ever bought, and we have had a lot of the different helicopters, etc.. It is easy for young kids to maneuver, great material for those times when it does crash. We really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C

customer_reviews.title: The details and colors are just great!! The LED lights in the front and ...
customer_reviews.text: The Millennium Falcon was the easiest of the three SW Air Hogs drones we got for Christmas. The details and colors are just great!! The LED lights in the front and back make the thing look like it's right out of the special effects department!! Everyone had so much fun flying this and speeder around, big hit on Christmas!!! It drove the dog crazy, he got a great workout chasing it around. The dog's name is Vader, so it does make a little sense!
customer_reviews.author: B Coset

customer_reviews.title: Chewy flying
customer_reviews.text: First time flying was a little frazzled, but with only a few trils, I can maneuver it well. My 10 year old daughter loves it, and is picking up the controls well. The battery life is not great, but for the price here...I am flying the Millennium Falcon
customer_reviews.author: Norman Swope

customer_reviews.title: Works great and requires minimal skills to learn to fly indoors
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son-in-law since he is a Star Wars fan. Works great and requires minimal skills to learn to fly indoors. Doesn't have the power to fly outside unless there is no wind what so ever. Makes a great shelf adornment as long as you can keep it out of the kids hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Fun for an afternoon but breaks very easily
customer_reviews.text: Fun for an afternoon but breaks very easily. Gave two stars because of good customer service after the first one broke (we were sent a replacement pretty quickly). Unfortunately the replacement also broke within a short time. Not for us.
customer_reviews.author: DtotheB

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable for being foam and flies steady. My ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly durable for being foam and flies steady. My husband was thrilled! Only negative is it doesn't hold a charge for long but that seems typical with these types of toys. It's also louder then expected.
customer_reviews.author: E. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: it's a little flimsy but it works fine. Just don't expect to be able to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves it! Yes, it's a little flimsy but it works fine. Just don't expect to be able to do crazy things with it or take it outside when there's any sort of breeze. All in all it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tbubbles

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but buyer beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool but if you'd like more than 10 minutes of fly time I would pass on this one. Has caused a lot of frustration in our home because it's this awesome looking toy that everyone wants to play with but there's not even enough time for the birthday boy to figure out how learn to fly it before its dead. Would not recommend at all!
customer_reviews.author: Bikramyogi

customer_reviews.title: Loud, flimsy but fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this. It's surprisingly flimsy as far as material and it's quite loud. But operationally it's pretty neat.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this as a present for my son. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a present for my son. He loves it! It's lightweight and rechargeable. Unlike most drones, this one flies evenly and the propellers are well protected keeping them safe from breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Who WOULDNT love a flying Millenium Falcon
customer_reviews.text: Who WOULDNT love a flying Millenium Falcon? This thing is awesome. Definitely for indoors only, but easy to control and fun to fly around. I use it at home and at the office.
customer_reviews.author: MDelloRusso

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it. Seriously the best money I have ever spent. So much fun to fly, the lights and sounds are dope and the material is styrofoamy enough that you won't break it without trying.
customer_reviews.author: avdescam

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: This isnt a fun remote control toy to fly. I have had 30 dollar remote control helicopters that are easier and more fun to fly. It is durable but the sound effects are terrible. I now just use it as a star wars model. Not worth anywhere clse to the price being paid.
customer_reviews.author: Todd hersey

customer_reviews.title: Fun and durable
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my brother-in-law for Christmas, and it's awesome. Easy to fly and pretty durable despite a number reenactments of how Han and Chewie brought the Falcon down on Starkiller Base.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schoenborn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome toy.
customer_reviews.text: Great little quadcopter to teach your kids on. Very durable. As Long as You Follow charging instructions, you'll consistently get 10 to 15 minutes of flight time. I'd recommend to use for indoor only, as it is easily tossed by the wind due to its light weight.
customer_reviews.author: JON K.

customer_reviews.title: First drone
customer_reviews.text: It is my first drone, so i am still learning how to fly it, but it surely respond vey well to controls and it is very resistant. I think it is a good drone for first timers.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly made- just foam, pretty much. It works sometimes and doesn't at other times. Do not waste your money. I bought it for my 7 year old and he's been able to fly it once. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Marlana B. McAlpin

customer_reviews.title: Good if there's no wind.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy. However, if there's even a smidge of wind... it doesn't work very well. It's VERY light weight. Still a great toy for inside, the garage, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: The drone came with a defective propeller so it didn't take off since it's needs all propellers to work correctly in order to fly. Due to this, I have a very disappointed 8 year old that waited anxiously for a week to get his birthday present.
customer_reviews.author: W Rey

customer_reviews.title: It's the Millennium Falcon...and it flies!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I'm too old to have one of these, but I needed to indulge my inner child and Star Wars enthusiast hoping this would actually fly. I find it easy to fly indoors with calm air. Forced air heat wreaks havoc on the unit, which is not surprising considering it is a solid object with very little mass. For $50 bucks, go ahead, indulge your inner child :D
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Good for lying indoors where there is no wind to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good for flying indoors where there is no wind to upset the balance. Battery life seems to be good for about an average of 10 minutes of flight before needing a recharge. All in all I'm happy with it as it was purchased as a toy for myself to take a break from desk work. Plus. It's the Millennium Flacon. Hard to be upset with that flying around your house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This drone is bad
customer_reviews.text: My grandparents bought this for me for Christmas. After i charged the drone for a long time, it had hardly any charge left. And the maneuverability is very bad. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: because it isn't as easy to control as we thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: The Falcon is a high-density foam, but don't be concerned. It drops without breaking. Stopped short of 5 stars, because it isn't as easy to control as we thought it would be. But fun anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not all that long but it's perfect for a first timer
customer_reviews.text: Millennium Falcon Quad .... works as well as Id hoped. Battery life is not all that long but it's perfect for a first timer. My son is four years old and can fly it around the house and yard slamming into things. It's crazy durable! Has banged into everything in the house and yard and even has a chunk bitten off by my Great Dane. Still flys!!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin hannon

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard to drive and it is styrofoam so it is extremely fragile and light the wind can easily sway a different way but it's fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: AmazingAR

customer_reviews.title: Fly the Kestle Run Yourself!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and I think our son had as much fun with it as the grandkids! It's and indoor flying toy due to the weight, and a whole lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Naulin

customer_reviews.title: Short flight life
customer_reviews.text: Flies great!!! Really cool watching the millennium falcon fly in your house and outside! Problem is, it lasts for about 10 min before needing another hour charge. Cannot get a better battery for it
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Millenium Falcon is Fun for All
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son (age 22) for Christmas and he loves it. It was easy to learn to fly but if you are using it in the house, it's very loud. The quality is very good. Great for kids of all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey B

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for a novelty.
customer_reviews.text: My Son absolutely loves this. He says it's super awesome, great fun. Great quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as christmas present for my son. It is a lot of fun, however the charge lasts for maybe 5 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Master Jedi
customer_reviews.text: My son-in-law is a Star Wars Fan and he loves the Air Hogs Star Wars Remote. He is the Master Jedi in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Master Gunny

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Christmas gift, packaged fine, but broke on the first play. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Holland-Miller

customer_reviews.title: So Cool!
customer_reviews.text: It's tough to learn the controls but it's really cool and my daughter and I love to fly it together! She's 7 and has no problems with it. Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dover

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Flies great inside and outside as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! Flies great inside and outside as long as it isn't very windy. Very sturdy! Also drives cats and dogs nuts!
customer_reviews.author: LexMom

customer_reviews.title: Cool drone for a young child
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 6 year old's birthday - he and his dad loved it. Not the most rugged toy and a little overpriced, but hey, it's star wars.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Home run gift for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Holding up well after a week of heavy use by a 12 year old. His flying skills get better every day. Kind of neat how he can "land" it flat aganist a wall. Would have liked a longer flight time, but ithe 5-7 minutes is typical for these small toys.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Young

customer_reviews.title: The boys love it. Down side is the battery life
customer_reviews.text: The boys love it. Down side is the battery life....only about 10 minutes of flying time. It's made of foam so indoor use only. Any breeze sends it tumbling out of the air
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mason

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the price. Flys about 5 minutes takes about an hour to charge, all you really need to know. Don't expect a super drone haha
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: great for my 10yr old
customer_reviews.text: great for my 10yr old. has great durability. battery last about 20min but charges after a couple hours. kids love it
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: pretty fun. does not work well with ANY breeze at all
customer_reviews.author: Deadman

customer_reviews.title: fun but...
customer_reviews.text: cute but booster doesn't work, sound effects sometimes work, and not as durable as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: jDB

customer_reviews.title: and is easy on furniture
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest toy we've had in a while. It's lightweight and soft, so it doesn't break when it lands or crashes, and is easy on furniture. For kids or adults, this is a thrilling item!
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: ... my brother who is in his 30's and he loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my brother who is in his 30's and he loved it ... for a few weeks, then he got bored of it. But it looks very cool and almost sends goose bumps down your spine when you fly it around ... but maybe that's only an effect for those who grew up with star wars as part of their childhood. :)
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made and not worth the $100 price. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Scovil

customer_reviews.title: Little loud, but flies great.
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my husband. He loves it. It is louder than other drones. But good overall.
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty cool. My son is very happy with it. That battery sure doesn't last long, though.
customer_reviews.author: Josey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, I got this for me as a stocking stuffer. My son uses it to terrorize our cats. I kids use gaming console controls this will come easy to them.
customer_reviews.author: Al Bergh

customer_reviews.title: need to work better
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the propellers in it sticks and now it does not work as well my husband had to mess with the propellers to get it to fly better
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love this but this is my first ever purchase of ...
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this but this is my first ever purchase of a RC quadcopter and trying to learn and master flying is hard when you can only learn for 15 minutes at a clip and have to wait an hour to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play
customer_reviews.text: Really fun to play with. Lasted a long time. D NOT USE OUTDOORS. INDOORS ONLY
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Apparently it is quite sturdy, and doesn't damage easily if you crash
customer_reviews.text: This gift was a big hit with my 10 year old grandson who got it for his birthday. Apparently it is quite sturdy, and doesn't damage easily if you crash.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Flood

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play  han!
customer_reviews.text: It's fun but takes time to learn to fly! Good for inside the house! Just need room to fly it!
customer_reviews.author: james Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm and as advertised. battery life isn't as long as you'd expect though.
customer_reviews.author: Sean E. Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: We had problems with the remote from time to time. We knew it was fully charged but wouldn't work for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: smrstgrl

customer_reviews.title: Fragile. Dont buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Junk. The charging port broke when we pulled the charging cable out. Its now useless and the company is impossible to get in touch with or get a response. We flew it twice and no loner have the box so we are stuck with an very expensive table top toy....
customer_reviews.author: J. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: I hesitated on buying this because in my experience Air ...
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated on buying this because in my experience Air Hogs have always been a let down. Don't Fear, this Air Hog will meet and even exceed your expectations. Bought as a Christmas gift for my 12 year old. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: My son loved this however the on off switch and one propeller ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this however the on off switch and one propeller broke immediately for no apparent reason. I think it may have just been a fluke. It was really very cool while it lasted. I'm exchanging to give it one more try. Fingers crossed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced junk. Upon arrival product didn't work, tried to ship it back but ended up taking 9 days too long to return product so I'm stuck with a non working drone. Made of styrofoam & low budget controller, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Murray

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing until it stopped working after maybe five uses. Surprisingly, it was the controller that stopped working, not the MF itself. The controller won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Boston

product_meta.title: Air Hogs Star Wars Remote Control Millennium Falcon Quad
product_meta.description: Now you can make the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs with the Flying Star Wars Ultimate Millennium Falcon! Fly the most iconic ship in the Star Wars universe right in your own home! The Ultimate Millennium Falcon takes flight with the power of 4 rotors concealed in the body of the ship. Its authentic lights and sounds bring the Millennium Falcon to life as you fly. Activate Hyperspace mode on the remote control and hold on for a fully loaded hyperspace journey. If your deflector shields go down, you’re still in good shape; the Millennium Falcon is constructed from durable high density foam making it resilient to a few photon torpedo hits. With 2.4GHz communication, you can control the Millennium Falcon up to 200 feet away! Join the rebellion and bring Star Wars home with the Millennium Falcon Quad from Air Hogs! Star Wars products are produced by Spin Master under license from Lucasfilm Ltd.
feature_bullets: Now you can fly the most iconic ship in the Star Wars universe: the Millennium Falcon Quad with iconic LED lights and authentic sounds!
The Millennium Falcon uses 4 rotors concealed on the body of the ship for agile, space-like flight!
Its 2.4Ghz communication lets you control the Millennium Falcon up to 200 feet away! Activates its hyper-drive stunt with the push of a button!
The Millennium Falcon is for star fighters aged 8+. 6 x AA batteries required for operation. For indoors and outdoors use.
Includes: 1 Millennium Falcon Quad, 1 Remote Control, 1 Instruction Guide

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars690 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
